comments:
The incoming markings are appearing more often than they should for a bugzilla query category in the task list. I synchronize, walk through all of the incoming marked bugs viewing them in the bugzilla editor. All incoming decorations disappear. I resynch the category and the inocming markings reappear. Not all reappear, but they seem to non-deterministically all get remarked as incoming at some point even though there appear to be no modifications to the bug (modification time is several days ago, no new comments, etc.).

This log message may be related but its not clear...

!ENTRY org.eclipse.mylar.core 4 0 2006-05-03 12:24:51.728

!MESSAGE notification failed for: org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasklist.ui.editors.TaskInfoEditor$1@19455a1


!STACK 0

java.lang.NullPointerException

	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasklist.ui.editors.TaskInfoEditor$1.localInfoChanged(TaskInfoEditor.java:142)

	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasklist.ui.editors.TaskInfoEditor$1.repositoryInfoChanged(TaskInfoEditor.java:176)

	at org.eclipse.mylar.provisional.tasklist.TaskList.notifyRepositoryInfoChanged(TaskList.java:482)

	at org.eclipse.mylar.provisional.tasklist.SynchronizeTaskJob.run(SynchronizeTaskJob.java:55)

	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

This is a known problem that we've been tracking with bug 124908, but I'm leaving this one open since the other discusses enhancements.

This is unfortunately misleading and has to get fixed for the next release, but didn't get prioritized into 0.5.1 since the RDF work can be disruptive to it (bug 136219).

Fixed, but lets keep our eye on this one as it has potential to re-emerge due to
future changes to the offline reports and generic attribute support.

Created an attachment (id=41204)
mylar/context/zip

Context related to incoming markers
